intro: Holigarna caustica, commonly known as the fiery spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its distinctive, milky sap that can cause skin irritation. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. Holigarna caustica produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a cup-shaped structure called a cyathium.
